results.title: A Case of Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme (ACE) Inhibitor-Induced Small Bowel Angioedema
results.text_hl: Wilin et al. discussed a case of a 62-year-old African American female with a two-year history of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ use who presented with @<m>DISEASE_Nausea</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@ and intermittent left @DISEASE_Otitis_Media @DISEASE_MESH:D010033 @@@middle@@@ and upper quadrant @DISEASE_Abdominal_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D015746 @@@abdominal pain@@@ .

citations.NLM: Pirzada S, Raza B, Mankani AA, Naveed B. A Case of Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme (ACE) Inhibitor-Induced Small Bowel Angioedema Cureus. 2023 Oct;15(10):e47739. PMID: 38022184
citations.BibTeX: @article{38022184, title={A Case of Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme (ACE) Inhibitor-Induced Small Bowel Angioedema}, author={Pirzada S and Raza B and Mankani AA and Naveed B}, journal={Cureus}, volume={15}, number={10}, pages={e47739}}

results.title: A Gut Feeling: Isolated Small Bowel Angioedema due to Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme Inhibitor.
results.text_hl: Here, we present a case of @DISEASE_Angioedema @DISEASE_MESH:D000799 @@@visceral angioedema@@@ in a 32-year-old @SPECIES_9606 @@@woman@@@ who presented with @DISEASE_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@left upper quadrant pain@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Nausea</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@, @DISEASE_Vomiting @DISEASE_MESH:D014839 @@@vomiting@@@, @DISEASE_Diarrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhea@@@, and characteristic radiographic signs of small @DISEASE_Edema @DISEASE_MESH:D004487 @@@bowel angio-edema@@@, six months after starting @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@.

citations.NLM: Pinto MB, Vecchio M, Santos MA. A Gut Feeling: Isolated Small Bowel Angioedema due to Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme Inhibitor. R I Med J (2013). 2022 Aug 1;105(6):28-31. PMID: 35881996
citations.BibTeX: @article{35881996, title={A Gut Feeling: Isolated Small Bowel Angioedema due to Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme Inhibitor.}, author={Pinto MB and Vecchio M and Santos MA}, journal={R I Med J (2013)}, volume={105}, number={6}, pages={28-31}}

results.title: A Rare Cause of Abdominal Pain: Intestinal Angioedema
results.text_hl: The authors describe a case of a 28-year-old @SPECIES_9606 @@@woman@@@ medicated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ 2 months before, with @DISEASE_Abdominal_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D015746 @@@abdominal pain@@@ associated with @<m>DISEASE_Nausea</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@, @DISEASE_Vomiting @DISEASE_MESH:D014839 @@@vomiting@@@ and a onetime watery stool.

citations.NLM: Ferreira TA, Alves MR, Oliveira AMP, Silva FSS, Pereira C. A Rare Cause of Abdominal Pain: Intestinal Angioedema J Med Cases. 2021 Apr;12(4):138-140. PMID: 34434446
citations.BibTeX: @article{34434446, title={A Rare Cause of Abdominal Pain: Intestinal Angioedema}, author={Ferreira TA and Alves MR and Oliveira AMP and Silva FSS and Pereira C}, journal={J Med Cases}, volume={12}, number={4}, pages={138-140}}

results.title: ACE Inhibitor Induced Isolated Angioedema of the Small Bowel: A Rare Complication of a Common Medication
results.text_hl: She was managed conservatively, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ was discontinued.

citations.NLM: Squillante MD, Trujillo A, Norton J, Bansal S, Dragoo D. ACE Inhibitor Induced Isolated Angioedema of the Small Bowel: A Rare Complication of a Common Medication Case Rep Emerg Med. 2021;2021():8853755. PMID: 33628527

results.title: Metformin Associated Lactic Acidosis in the Intensive Care Unit: A Rare Condition Mimicking Sepsis
results.text_hl: @GENE_BMP1 @GENE_649 @@@BMP@@@ was unremarkable a month ago when started on @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@.

results.title: Clinical experience with lisinopril. Observations on safety and tolerability.
results.text_hl: In the @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ population, the most frequent adverse events reported were @DISEASE_Headache @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@, @DISEASE_Dizziness @DISEASE_MESH:D004244 @@@dizziness@@@, @DISEASE_Cough @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Nausea</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@, @DISEASE_Diarrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhoea@@@ and @DISEASE_Fatigue @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@, although not all of these events were thought to be related to @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@; 6.1% discontinued @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ due to adverse clinical events, most commonly @DISEASE_Cough @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Nausea</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@.

citations.NLM: Cameron HA, Higgins TJ. Clinical experience with lisinopril. Observations on safety and tolerability. J Hum Hypertens. 1989 Jun;3 Suppl 1():177-86. PMID: 2550641
citations.BibTeX: @article{2550641, title={Clinical experience with lisinopril. Observations on safety and tolerability.}, author={Cameron HA and Higgins TJ}, journal={J Hum Hypertens}, volume={3 Suppl 1}, pages={177-86}}

results.title: Post-marketing surveillance of lisinopril in general practice in the UK.
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Cough @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@Cough@@@, malaise and @DISEASE_Fatigue @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Nausea</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@ and @DISEASE_Vomiting @DISEASE_MESH:D014839 @@@vomiting@@@ were more frequent causes of withdrawal from @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ than @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@.

citations.NLM: Fallowfield JM, Blenkinsopp J, Raza A, Fowkes AG, Higgins TJ, Bridgman KM. Post-marketing surveillance of lisinopril in general practice in the UK. Br J Clin Pract. 1993 Nov-Dec;47(6):296-304. PMID: 8117550

results.title: Review of international safety data for lisinopril-hydrochlorothiazide combination treatment.
results.text_hl: In clinical trials, adverse experiences in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ treated with a @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@-@CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@hydrochlorothiazide@@@ combination were @DISEASE_Dizziness @DISEASE_MESH:D004244 @@@dizziness@@@ (7.5%), @DISEASE_Headache @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@ (5.2%), @DISEASE_Cough @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@ (3.9%), @DISEASE_Fatigue @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@ (3.7%), @DISEASE_Headache @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@orthostatic effects@@@ (3.2%), @DISEASE_Diarrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhoea@@@ (2.5%), @<m>DISEASE_Nausea</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@ (2.2%) and @DISEASE_Respiratory_Tract_Infections @DISEASE_MESH:D012141 @@@upper respiratory tract infection@@@ (2.2%).

citations.NLM: Murray NH. Review of international safety data for lisinopril-hydrochlorothiazide combination treatment. J Hum Hypertens. 1991 Dec;5 Suppl 2():63-7; discussion 68. PMID: 1665180
citations.BibTeX: @article{1665180, title={Review of international safety data for lisinopril-hydrochlorothiazide combination treatment.}, author={Murray NH}, journal={J Hum Hypertens}, volume={5 Suppl 2}, pages={63-7; discussion 68}}

results.title: Syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone secretion associated with lisinopril.
results.text_hl: OBJECTIVE: To describe a case of the @DISEASE_Inappropriate_ADH_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D007177 @@@syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone secretion@@@ (@DISEASE_Inappropriate_ADH_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D007177 @@@SIADH@@@) associated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ therapy. CASE SUMMARY: A 76-year-old white @SPECIES_9606 @@@woman@@@ who was being treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@ for @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ presented with @DISEASE_Headache @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headaches@@@ accompanied by @<m>DISEASE_Nausea</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@ and a @DISEASE_Paresthesia @DISEASE_MESH:D010292 @@@tingling sensation@@@ in her arms.

citations.NLM: Shaikh ZH, Taylor HC, Maroo PV, Llerena LA. Syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone secretion associated with lisinopril. Ann Pharmacother. 2000 Feb;34(2):176-9. PMID: 10676825
citations.BibTeX: @article{10676825, title={Syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone secretion associated with lisinopril.}, author={Shaikh ZH and Taylor HC and Maroo PV and Llerena LA}, journal={Ann Pharmacother}, volume={34}, number={2}, pages={176-9}}
